meanings.definition: In a manner resembling or using a telescope.
meanings.sent1: She gazed telescopically at the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: He observed the distant mountains telescopically through his binoculars.
meanings.sent3: The detective searched telescopically for clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: Her focus on the details was so sharp, it was as if she saw the world telescopically.
meanings.sent5: The scientist examined the cells telescopically, looking for any abnormalities.

meanings.definition: Extending or retracting like a telescope.
meanings.sent1: The telescopically antenna could be adjusted to receive signals from different directions.
meanings.sent2: The telescopically handle of the suitcase made it easy to carry around.
meanings.sent3: The robot had a telescopically arm that could reach high shelves effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: His telescopically legs allowed him to adjust his height based on the situation.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter used a telescopically ladder to rescue the cat from the tree.
